snippet: The origins of Ferguson’s complex racial history run deep, and the residents of the largely black city with a white power structure say that most tensions have to do with an overzealous police force.
abstract: Protests surrounding shooting death of unarmed black teenager Michael Brown have revealed deep tensions that have existed in community of Ferguson, Mo; origins of area's complex social and racial history date to the 19th century when city of St Louis and St Louis County went their separate ways, leading to formation of dozens of smaller communities outside St Louis.

byline.original: By TANZINA VEGA and JOHN ELIGON
byline.contributor: Tanzina Vega reported from Ferguson, and John Eligon from Kansas City, Mo. Serge F. Kovaleski contributed reporting from New York, and John Schwartz from Ferguson. Alain Delaquérière contributed research.

lead_paragraph: The origins of Ferguson’s complex racial history run deep, and the residents of the largely black city with a white power structure say that most tensions have to do with an overzealous police force.

headline.main: Deep Tensions Rise to Surface After Ferguson Shooting
headline.print_headline: Deep Tensions Rise to Surface After Shooting
